question: Which country houses "Kaali Crater"?
explanation: Kaali Crater is a group of nine meteorite craters located in the Kaali village of Saaremaa Island of Estonia. These craters are thought to have happened in the Holocene period, around 3500 years ago. Kaali Lake is on the bottom of this crater. The impact energy caused due to the meteorite impact was about 80 TJ which is comparable with that of the Hiroshima bomb blast.
